ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Intelligent Robotics is a course about the history of robot intelligence and development. It's interesting stuff, and it's a pretty easy class.
History of robotics with some practice in coding and architecture design. A great introduction into the field. I would absolutely recommend the course, it was a lot of fun.
I recommend this course because it is tense and understandable. I had not only theoritical knowledge, but also practical experience through the problem sets.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I think it helped me put into perspective the work that I'm doing now in light of what's been done in the past. I don't think I'll use any of the methods discussed, but it's good to know for perspective.
As a mechanical engineer I learned much of the vocabulary that I will be using for the rest of my career.

This course gave me how to create the artificial intelligence to interact with real environments including the social envirionment. My study is to examine the way to imporve social environments using information technology and artificial intelligence. Thus, this course could compensate the engineering aspects of my study. It was very helpful to deepen the way to design social system using technology.
